facts.description: Python project structure includes directories for data, a fabfile, and a virtual environment.
Fabric tasks are defined with the @task decorator and can be run using the fab command.
AI integration requires using environment variables for API keys and planning prompts for structured JSON output.
Docker containers package code and dependencies, ensuring consistent AI environments.
Personal APIs are custom endpoints, while MCP servers coordinate multiple clients.
CI/CD automates testing and deployment using tools like GitHub Actions and Docker pipelines.
Structured prompts yield predictable AI output, and JSON skeletons ensure workflow stability.
Environment variables should be stored in .bashrc or .zshrc to prevent accidental key leaks.

habits.description: Daily reflections help track progress and plan next steps.
Regular practice improves debugging and workflow design.
